content.question: Which of the following justifies the claim that electrons can exhibit wave behavior?

choices.label: An electron collides with a positron and they annihilate each other, producing photons.
A beam of electrons incident on a crystal produces a diffraction pattern.
An electron is repelled by another nearby electron.
An electron in an antenna oscillates with the electric field of a radio signal.

content.answer: A beam of electrons incident on a crystal produces a diffraction pattern.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
